items.description: Returns a logging.Logger object for both site and bench level logging. If the logger doesn't exist, it is created.
Logs a message with the level 'INFO'. Useful for tracking normal application events.
items.example:
user = frappe.session.user
logger.info(f"{user} accessed counter_app.update with value={value}")

items.description: Logs a message with the level 'DEBUG'. Useful for detailed information, typically during development and troubleshooting.
Logs a message with the level 'WARNING'. Indicates a potential issue that doesn't prevent the program from running.
Logs a message with the level 'ERROR'. Records a serious error that has occurred.
items.example: logger.error('Failed to connect to the database.')

items.description: Logs a message with the level 'CRITICAL'. Records a critical error that might lead to the application terminating.
items.example: logger.critical('System shutdown due to critical failure.')

items.description: Sets the logging level dynamically for Frappe processes. Levels include 'DEBUG', 'INFO', 'WARNING', 'ERROR', 'CRITICAL'.
